p: The study took place in seven independent farmer-managed vegetable gardens in Kasaragod. These sites stood 3–10 km apart. The farmers of these sites cultivate rice paddy as their main crop, sowing in June to August and harvesting in November to January months of the year. From November to April, they cultivate vegetables belong to Amaranthaceae, Cucurbitaceae, Malvaceae, Solanaceae, and Fabaceae families as smallholdings (approximately one-acre land).
